annotation.TEXT: I'm going to go with a Haggle Man for 5-2, but which one? ...I'll pick the purple one.
Oh, but there's three Zeldas here to choose from. Hmm... I'll go with the Oracle games one. (It's not just Oracle of Seasons. Zelda is in Oracle of Ages, too.)
Wow, I'm surprised that multi-coin block lasted long enough for me to get 15 coins there. In the original SMB, I'd only be able to get at most 11 coins in this situation.
Fortunately, if you duck on the sea floor, the Bloopers (or Tektites in this case) won't hit you.
Ooh, is that the boomerang? Cool. Still not as awesome as the AWESOME SPREAD GUN, but it's usually my favorite Castlevania subweapon.
Too bad it doesn't work on Bullet Bills. It works pretty well on Koopas and Goombas though. (This might be fun to use on Bowser at some point!)
I'm guessing the multi-coin block timer in this game is more generous to give some other characters a fair shot at getting the maximum amount of coins.
Oh, why did I jump there? I'm such an idiot!
Oh, and attacks hit faster, I guess.
Ack! Let me let go of this block! Okay, forget about ninja starring a bullet for now.
Doesn't look like it. Maybe my ninja stars will work?
I'm waiting for a good opening between the fire bar and the podoboos, but it's not giving me very good openings right now...
So, Zelda rescues Impa, and she's looking for Link.

Oh, yeah. If you go into the pause menu options, you can do things like change the graphics on the spot. And, this is where you can toggle Random Map Skin option, which you can't do from the player select screen for some reason. Alright, so let's show off that Game Boy Filter...
I wonder... Can Haggle Man destroy Bullet Bills?
Well, let's give Luigi another spin here...
I found one, but that only gave me 5 NP. I'd kind of like more than that.

Ah, SMB Crossover got that detail right, where Mari0 didn't. A kicked shell can indeed destroy random Bullet Bills in 5-3 (or *1-3) of the original SMB. (I mention Mari0 here because NakaTeleeli was killed by a Bullet Bill that he kicked a shell at in 5-3 there. Click here to see where that happened to Naka.)
Got it! It's actually a bit easier to do here than in the original SMB because I don't have to worry about a sprite limit keeping some enemies from spawning. Also, two-way scrolling helps.
Awesome! Mario would obviously be just as good, and I think any Mega Man or Bass skin that can slide or dash could probably keep up well enough too.

Alright, so world 5 is now behind us, so which characters/skins/random/whatever should I use for world 6? Place your votes now! (A swift character might be helpful for 6-2, since I'll want to go through all four bonus rooms in that level.)
Also, let's turn off that GB filter now. I'd prefer to play this game in full color.

Okay, there's this super-ultra-mega-large fire bar here, the only one of its kind in the original SMB (not counting the second quest, where it also appears in *2-4, but it's the exact same level as 5-4.)
Whoa. Good thing for my double jump there!
Whoa. Almost overshot the pipe there. Yeah, I've gotta remember how loose the controls for the Mario Bros. are, especially Luigi.
Awesome, I got both the 5000 and the six fireworks this time.
Yeah, it doesn't work. Only stomps from the Mario Bros. and certain other strong attacks can defeat the fire-immune enemies.
Now, that death was entirely my own fault. I can't blame that one on a glitch or bad level design or anything like that!
Now, I usually don't like going down this pipe when playing SMB normally, but I feel like I've gotta show off every area when playing this (and look for inaccuracies).
This room looks so much better in full color with SMW graphics.
Whew. I survived that encounter.
Now, I may not be able to swim, but I can jump higher underwater, and my wall-clinging ability greatly reduces the danger of me falling into a pit here.
Cool, I got more donuts and my power ups back.
Yep, every base character has an Atari-like skin.
I'm searching for donuts here to refill my NP with.
Alright, it's boss time, against good ol' Bowser himself! ...Wait, that should be "bad" ol' Bowser himself!
Hmm... Do I feel like finishing world 5 right now? Sure, why not? Okay, so who should I go with next? Well, there was a vote for Zelda, one of Link's skins...

Ha. I figured I could duck under that bullet. I'm guessing that any character capable of ducking in this game will actually shrink their hitboxes to small Mario's size, regardless of what their sprite looks like.
What the? Why are there four coins down here? Were these placed there intentionally, or did somebody screw up in the level design again?
Sweet! Oh, has the hidden 1-up block also respawned as well?
Oh, right. I had other subweapons I could've used. Well, whatever.

Alright, now there was no clear winner for second place, so I'll just pick one of them. Oh, and the alt. skin votes this time included Cut Man/Ice Man/Rokko Chan (Mega Man), Quick Man (Bass), Zelda (Link), Haggle Man (Ryu), and anyone in their Atari-like skin.

Hello, and welcome back to SMB Crossover! The votes are shown above again like usual. Also, there was 1 vote for YouTube to let the voter go back in the video after reaching the end of it, and at least 108,177 votes for Google to change the YT comment section back.
D'oh! I got the six fireworks, but I only got 2000 points from the flagpole itself.
What was that, a donut? Well, I could try hitting a bullet with a ninja star now...
Nuts. I let my ride get away from me, missing a lot of coins in the process. Also, I'm running low on time. D'oh, and Haggle Man can't even reach the highest coins here!
Ha. That wizard didn't stand a chance against me (mainly because he situated himself on top of ? blocks)! Now let's climb up to the sky bonus area!
D'oh! Just missed the 6...
Yeah, now everything's monochrome. Also, Luigi is really good for this level because he's one of the few characters that can keep up with a kicked shell well enough to get 1-up combos!
I can't hurt Buzzy Beetles with my sword, but I know what can... assuming I can safely get it from the Hammer Bro. over here...
Wow, then I actually get a 1-life profit from that death! Umm... Yeah, that was totally my intention when I "accidently" jumped into that parakoopa's feet before! ...Seriously!
Bah, I got hammered, so now I've lost that sword power up. In addition, I've run out of NP here, so this could get dicey...
Yeah, there's no 1-up to get there. There was only enough enemies to reach 8000 in that stretch.
Huh? That's weird. Instead of the usual "Hurry up!" sound effect, the music simply restarted when the timer fell below 100 this time...
Huh. What does that sword do? Looks like it increased my attack range.
Okay, found a decent-enough opening.
To be continued...
Alright, so Random came out on top with 2 votes, so let's see what the RNG decides...
Alright, that's better. Oh, and I don't think that death will actually hurt me, since I can just get a 1-up back from kicking a shell again!
Gotcha! I have no idea if that last-second boomerang toss made any difference.
Yep, I'm just killing time in front of this bullet cannon while I wait for my invincibility to wear off, because I want to get the next 1-up combo as well.
Demo count: 3
Oh, man. Just listen to that totally awesome Mario music!
Well, it helps if I could aim, and now I'm out of NP. Nuts.
Now to backtrack for the usual reasons, and test my ninja star on a bullet here.
Oh, neat! The boomerang can scoop up coins for me! That's really cool! (Yes, it can retrieve items in the Zelda games, but I wasn't expecting it to work on loose coins here!)
The sea life could be a big threat though, especially since my main attack is short-range.
Alright, thanks Mr. Robotic Plant!
Cool, I got the magical boomerang. (I picked that up in my bonus episode of 2-1, but that wasn't saved to my main file.)
Alright, now who's next? Well, raocow wanted to see a character with Atari-like graphics, and there was a vote for Simon that didn't specify a skin, so let's go with... Atari 2600 Simon!
Ah, I see that there's no erroneously placed fire bar on the left edge of this ledge here, which is correct. So, how come there was an extra fire bar there in 2-4?
Alright, let's not stupidly die to a parakoopa again. As awesome as life-farming sounds, I would kind of like to make some progress in this game today.
The RNG has chosen Luigi! Cool, he's going to be really nice for this level!
Yep, I can certainly star-kill the Buzzies! Now, I don't have time to clean out this multi-coin block, but at least I've confirmed that it's in the right spot.
Just flingin' my boomerang for the heck of it. I can launch it in any of 8 different directions, just like in the original Zelda, which is cool.
